thread.title: CORRECTING and REPLACING SurveyMonkey Appoints Meg Whitman to Board of Directors
thread.title_full: CORRECTING and REPLACING SurveyMonkey Appoints Meg Whitman to Board of Directors

author: admin
title: CORRECTING and REPLACING SurveyMonkey Appoints Meg Whitman to Board of Directors
text:
Submitted by admin on 9/10/2015 @ 11:56 AM Companies mentioned in this article: SurveyMonkey 
PALO ALTO, Calif. -- (BUSINESS WIRE) -- Second paragraph, second sentence of release should read: Her vision, coupled with her track record of success and innovation at some of the most iconic software and Internet companies in the world, makes her an extremely valuable addition to SurveyMonkey,” said company CEO Bill Veghte. (instead of making her). 
The corrected release reads: SurveyMonkey Appoints Meg Whitman to Board of Directors 
SurveyMonkey, the leading online survey platform, today announced that Meg Whitman has joined the company’s Board of Directors. Whitman currently serves as Chairman, President, and CEO of HP. 
“We are honored to have Meg join our board. Her vision, coupled with her track record of success and innovation at some of the most iconic software and Internet companies in the world, makes her an extremely valuable addition to SurveyMonkey,” said company CEO Bill Veghte. “I am personally looking forward to Meg’s perspective as we focus on delivering solutions that provide convenient, real-time access to the insights, opinions and data that matter most to our customers.” 
“I have followed SurveyMonkey for many years,” said Whitman. “I’ve also worked closely with several of the current Board members and there is a tremendously experienced and talented team in place. I look forward to helping to continue the momentum and capture the significant opportunities ahead.” 
This past year, SurveyMonkey has been focused on helping customers do more with their survey results. Most recently, the company announced the acquisition of TechValidate, a web-based software platform that gives customers the ability to publish marketing content from their survey findings. The company also focused on providing context to stand-alone survey data by launching a platform this past April called SurveyMonkey Benchmarks where organizations can compare their performance against peers, competitors and companies of similar size. 
In 1999, SurveyMonkey transformed the research industry when it created an online survey tool that was simple and elegant enough for everyone to use, not just market researchers. Today, over 25 million customers use SurveyMonkey in different ways, including capturing feedback, testing ideas and predicting elections. 
“We could not be more thrilled to be adding such an experienced and talented executive to our Board,” said Zander Lurie, SurveyMonkey’s Chairman of the Board. “I am very much looking forward to working with Meg in this capacity and welcome her to the SurveyMonkey family.” 
With the appointment of Whitman, SurveyMonkey’s Board of Directors will increase to nine members, including David Ebersman, Dana L. Evan, Ryan Finley, Lee Fixel, Zander Lurie, Sheryl Sandberg, Benjamin C. Spero and Bill Veghte. 
About SurveyMonkey 
SurveyMonkey is the world's leading online survey platform, with more than 3 million survey responses every day. SurveyMonkey has revolutionized the way people give and take feedback, making it accessible, easy and affordable for everyone. The company was founded in 1999 with a focus on helping people make better decisions, and has built technology based on over 10 years of experience in survey methodology and web development. Customers include 99% of the Fortune 500, academic institutions, organizations and neighborhood soccer leagues everywhere. 
The company has over 500 employees throughout the United States and Europe, with headquarters in Palo Alto, CA. For more information, visit www.surveymonkey.com .
